args: *groan* Another failure.\nThe theory is soundâ€”so why?
How many attempts does this make?\nA dozen? A DOZEN dozen?
Perhaps I truly am grasping at straws here.\nI mean, a wormhole through space-time?\nThere's plausible, and then there's...that.
W-wait, what am I saying?! Past or\nfuture me, you didn't hear that!
I'm just a little tired and discouraged.\nMhm. That's all. I didn't really meanâ€”
...ear me? My past self, can y...
Wait! Does this mean that future me has\nsucceeded in sending her voice back to\npresent me?
I can't hear herâ€”me?â€”anymore.\nBut if I piece together what I could\nmake out, I get...
ï¼‚If I go on a summer seaside vacation,\nmy experiment will be a success.ï¼‚\nWell, me, you heard the...me! Let's go!
...Which is why this vacation\nis actually vital to my work!\nCan I count on your assistance?

I do not mind a trip to the shore, but I
am still struggling with your story.
You're CERTAIN it was your voice
from the future you heard?
Yes. Absolutely. Establishing a bridge\nbetween the past and future is, like,\nWormholes 101!
My future self was finally able to\nsuccessfully create one and use it\nto give her past selfâ€”me!â€”a hint.
You can skip all the brainiac jargon. You\njust had to put the words ï¼‚beachï¼‚ and ï¼‚tripï¼‚\nin the same general area and I was IN.

Same here! I'm gonna swim until every
muscle is screamin', and then pig out
on more barbecue than you can shake
a pig at!
Please don't shake a pig. *ahem*\nYour individual motivations aside,\nthank you all so much for your cooperation!
Er, hello, Erasmus. Do you always pack\nquite so...thoroughly? Your suitcase\nis positively bulging.
Oh, that's my fault. I asked him to help\ntransport all of my research equipment\nfrom the Halidom.
You intend to experiment even here?
Of course! Research is my life!\nI may step away from my lab,\nbut never from my work!
Even so, performing volatile experiments\non a crowded beach seems ill-advised.\nWhat if there is another explosion?
She could always use my old cave as a\nbase of operations. It's sturdy enough,\nand out of the way.
Then, once that's done, I have\nmatters to attend to on my own.
Alone? ...Ah, of course.\nYou must have a lot of memories here.
Indeed I do. Now, I'll be off.
Speaking of memories, this place reminds\nme of the adventurer Simon, his treasure,\nand our clash with Barbary.
Ah, the betentacled menace herself.\nIncidentally, I hear she's turned up again\nright here on Lewis Island.
Fortunately, Estelle went to the beach\nwhere she was sighted to nip her mischief\nin the bud with a stern lecture.
In other words, we don't have any\nshenanigans to worry about this time.\nSummer fun, here we come!
Ever the excitable buffoon... *ahem*\nREMEMBER TO STRETCH FIRST, LUCA!
I'll go scrounge up some grub for that\nbeachside barbecue I was talkin' about.
Perhaps I'll indulge in a little\nbeachcombing.
Swimming, grilling, strolling on the sand...\nFascinating. There are so many ways to\nenjoy a summer vacation.
Yep. Everyone's trying to make the most\nof the trip in their own unique ways.
Vacations are special precisely because\nthey don't come along every day. Don't be\nafraid to let loose a little, Sinoa.
Let loose, you say? Very well!\nThen first, I shall...
Come to think of it, I don't know that\nI've ever actually TAKEN a vacation.
It's just so hot outside in the summer that\nI was always more comfortable holed up\nin the lab.
What's the procedure here, anyway?\nShow me the way, science!
